reviews.review: Not satisfied with this product. Dupatta print and colour was not according to expectation and also not matched with kurta. Product stuff was also not good as expected. No price tag was attached with it. On returning this product, I face so many problems, as the boy was not able to track the ID and was  saying that this product should not be returned. That's quite unsatisfied. This product is so cheap and beyond my expectations.

The kurta is good. But the material of the bottom and dupatta could be better. As the palazzo bottom has design looks good, but if it would be stitched with some stiff material to support from inside, it would be perfect. The bottom tends to roll over when using.  Dupatta again, super light and soft, full size, but something for the border would be better. Overall the stitching should have been done with some expert thinking. The print is kind of rubber one, and looks a little dull than seen in the picture. Certainly a HIGHLY EDITED product image is used.  Still would say a good to buy for regular use.

The overall dress is good. The only problem is with the dupatta, the dupatta is of low material cotton and the kurta-palazzo is rayon. Because of the low material cotton dupatta the overall get up lowers down. According to the price...the material of the cotton dupatta is not upto the mark.

description.Product Details:
Special Technique/Craft:
Ajrakh: The authentic Ajrakh is printed on both sides by a method known as resist printing. This form of printing is done by hand with hand-carved wooden blocks. Several different blocks are used to give the characteristic repeated patterning. Traditional 'Ajrakh' involves various stages of dyeing and resist printing using natural dyes and mordants. Indigo and madder are the primary colours that are used for dyeing. The resist and some colours are printed on the cloth using carved wooden blocks. These blocks are carved with intricate symmetrical patterns so that the same block can be used for both sides of the clot

description.Product Details:
About the Brand
An Ode etched in the Pataudi lifestyle, offering contemporary ethnic wardrobe solutions balancing modernity with tradition. The line offers affordable ethnic wear for the urban youth by extending statement cuts, with innovative fabrics to create a bold signature styling. This line beautifully balances vibrancy and tradition with novelty and elegance.

About the story : Meher
Hand embroidered chikankari highlighted with mirror work, foil prints and white and gold embroideries of flora and fauna.

About the craft
The craft of Chikan work, often referred to as Lucknow Chikan, is over 400 years old with a firm presence in the Indian and global fashion arena. Chikan, in the literal sense means 'embroidery'. This traditional embroidery style is one of Lucknow's most ancient and well-known art forms, believed to be introduced by the Mughals. The main essence of this alluring art is a simple design, and beautifully handcrafted patterned embroided on the garments. White floral embroidered shirt dress

  • Mandarin collar
  • Sleeveless, no sleeves
  • Above knee length in straight hem
  • Button closure
